text: Reality Capture is getting a branding
makeover. Reality Capture will become
Reality Scan. Reality Scan 2.0
introduces critical updates from AI
assisted masking to alignment
improvements, visual quality inspection,
and support for aerial LAR. Here's a
quick rundown of the powerful new
features in Reality Scan
2.0. Automatically remove backgrounds
with a train segmentation model. No need
to manually mask, rename, or import
images. Reality Scan interprets your
object and separates it from the scene,
streamlining your workflow from raw
photos to reconstruction ready
data. Say goodbye to broken alignments.
New default settings improve image
alignment, especially on surfaces with
minimal features. You get better model
consistency with fewer manual
interventions. Reality Scan 2.0 O will
support aerial LAR data. The new version
combines aerial imagery, aerial LAR, and
terrestrial data to generate precise
orthographic projections, maps, and 3D
models, improving the accuracy of your
mapping and surveying tasks. Perfect for
simulation, mapping, or VFX environments
where realworld fidelity
matters. Reality Scan shows you where
your scan may be incomplete. Using
visual heat maps, you can pinpoint the
areas that need more data before moving
to the meshing stage or check the
quality of your mesh for further texture
and PBR improvements. Reality Scan 2.0
will be available soon. Stay tuned. We
can't wait for you to scan the world.
